The @view-transition at-rule has two descriptions. One is the commonly used navigation descriptor. The second is types, the lesser-known of the two, and one that probably envies how much attentionÂ navigationÂ gets. But read on to learn why we need types and how it opens up new possibilities for custom view transitions when navigating between pages.

articles.description:
When it comes to positioning elements on a page, including text, there are many ways to go about it in CSS â€” the literal position property with corresponding inset-* properties, translate, margin, anchor() (limited browser support at the moment), and so forth. The offset property is another one that belongs in that list.
Positioning Text Around Elements With CSS Offset originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
